definition: to tell a lie
to pull/to tear/(of cloth, thread etc) to buy/to chat/to gossip/(coll.) (Tw) ridiculous/hokey
variant of 扯[che3]/to pull/to tear
lies/to lie

sentences.english: They lie and cheat and send young Americans to their death solely for their own profit.
sentences.chinese: 他们为了自己的利益扯谎作弊，让美国年轻人去送死。

sentences.english: All advertising tells lies, but there are little lies and there are big lies.
sentences.chinese: 所有广告都在扯谎，只不过是小谎和大谎的区别。

sentences.english: A liar is not considered when he speaks the truth.
sentences.chinese: 扯谎者纵使讲实话也没人相信。

sentences.english: She threw the lie in his face.
A boaster and a liar are cousins- german.
sentences.chinese: 吹法螺与扯谎本是同宗。

sentences.english: You should not tell a lie and say you have five years of experience when you really have two.
sentences.chinese: 如果你惟有两年的经验，你就不应该扯谎说有五年。
我们扯谎是为了避免冲突。

sentences.english: Xiao dream points out that lie crescent.
Research shows we lie less to people that we are close to.
sentences.chinese: 研究剖明我们对自己对照亲密的人扯谎少一些。

sentences.english: For thy records, and what we see doth lie.
sentences.chinese: 因为你的记载和我所见都扯谎。

sentences.english: B boaster and a liar are cousins-german.
sentences.chinese: 吹法螺与扯谎本是同宗。

definition: to tell lies
to speak without thinking/to blurt sth out
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
to lie through one's teeth (idiom)/to talk drivel
lie
to lie/to tell an untruth
to expose/to unmask/to see through (a lie etc)
to mislead/to swindle
to argue strenuously or with sophistry/to quibble
to lie through one's teeth (idiom)/to talk drivel
pinyin: zheng1 zhe5 yan3 jing1 shuo1 xia1 hua4

definition: to expose/to uncover
to speak off the cuff/to casually opine
to quibble
to chatter/nonsense/blather
to joke/to laugh insincerely/to make merry/to talk irrelevantly
